subject: Politics
title: Youth and Political Change
description: A fast breakdown of Youth and Political Change for builders.

hook.text: The average age in Africa is 19. Young populations demand change faster than old governments can adapt.

buildup.text: Youth bulges ‚Äî large young populations ‚Äî create pressure for jobs, rights, and representation.

discovery.text: Young people led the Arab Spring, Hong Kong protests, and climate strikes. Youth energy drives modern movements.

twist.text: Youth activism is powerful but fragile. Without institutional power, energy fades and old elites outlast the young.

climax.text: Climate change, AI, and inequality will shape young people's politics. Their battles are just beginning.

punchline.text: Young people have the numbers. Turning energy into power is the test.

quiz.question: What is a 'youth bulge'?
options: A large young population that creates political and economic pressure for change
A small elderly population in developed nations
A decline in birth rates across all countries
